page.title: 09Ecology
page.content: Included in our 4 by 3km block is the Beacon Bog. This is the best example of an actively growing basin mire in west Wales.The peat is up to 2 meters (6.5ft)deep and occupies a shallow depression lined by boulder clay.Bog vegetation extends to about half of the total catchment and there is a single outflow stream.The classic bog vegetation sequence of hollows,pools and hummocks is well developed.Bog mosses,of which 5 different species, fill the wet hollows.Heather,cross leaved heath and purple moor grass are abundant,especially on the hummocks. Purple moor grass dominates the drier margins of the bog.Among the other flowers and plants growing in the 29 acres of marshland are the bog rosemary,the northern marsh orchid,the cranberry,the royal fern and the petty whin.
